column2: WISCONSIN DRIVERS PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. If you are under 18 you have additional license restrictions for the first 9 months for:
column4: the type and number of passengers that can be in your car.
column6: the reasons you can drive between midnight and 5AM.

column2: 2. Before passing another vehicle, you should signal:
column6: early enough so other drivers know your intention.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
4. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column4: find a safe place to stop for a break.
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column10: have a beer or two to keep you awake.

column2: 5. If you are stopped and the officer suspects you have been drinking:
column4: you can refuse to take the test if you think you will fail.
column6: you can refuse to take the test if you haven't been drinking.
column8: you are required to take the test.

column2: 6. If you approach a flashing red traffic light, you should treat the intersection the same as:
7. When drivers see this road sign:
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.
column10: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.

column2: 8. Which statement about drinking alcohol and driving is true?
column4: If you are under the legal BAC limit, your driving is not affected.
column6: Alcohol affects judgement and coordination, which are needed to drive safely.
column8: After drinking, a cold shower will sober you up.

column2: 9. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.

11. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column4: get some rest or change drivers.

13. This road sign means:
14. Most signs used in street work areas are:
15. The recommended speed for backing is no faster than:
16. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column4: only if the traffic signal turns red.
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 17. This sign means:
18. Braking distance is affected by:
column4: the condition of your brakes and tires.
column6: the speed your vehicle is traveling.

column2: 19. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: pass the car on the left.
column6: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column8: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.
column10: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.

column2: 20. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column4: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 21. This road sign means:
22. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: passing is not permitted in either direction.
column6: the lane to the left may pass.
column8: the lane to the right may pass.
column10: passing is permitted in either direction.

column2: 23. When driving behind a motorcycle, drivers must:
column4: drive on the shoulder beside the motorcycle.
column6: remembers that motorcyclists have the right to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: share the lane with the motorcycle.
column10: pass the motorcycle in the same lane.

column2: 24. This road sign means:
column4: You must not travel below the speed indicated
column6: You must travel at the speed indicated
column8: The maximum speed limit under ideal conditions

column2: 25. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
26. Vehicle stopping distance never depends on:
column4: the condition and type of vehicle tires.
column10: the condition of your vehicle's brakes.

column2: 27. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 28. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
29. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
30. Drivers may cross solid yellow lines:
column8: only to pass traffic moving in the same direction.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
32. Blocking an intersection during rush hour traffic is not permitted:
column8: unless you entered the intersection on a green light.

column2: 33. Driving at night is more dangerous because:
column8: you cannot see as far ahead at night.

column2: 34. When driving in normal conditions, drivers should check their rearview mirror for traffic behind them:
35. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 36. Roads are the most slippery:
column4: for the first 2 hours of a rain storm.
column6: the first rain after a dry spell.
column8: after it has been raining for an hour or more.

column2: 37. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column8: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.

column2: 38. What should drivers do when the red lights begin to flash?
39. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.
column8: use the road edge as a guide until the approaching vehicle passes by.

column2: 40. This sign indicates:
column4: the entrance to a dead-end street.
column6: that you must not drive past this sign.
column8: the entrance to a construction site.
column10: that you must yield the right-of-way.

column2: 41. When the traffic light is green, but traffic is blocking the intersection, drivers should:
column4: enter the intersection and wait for traffic to clear.
column6: honk their horn to establish their right-of-way.
column8: not enter the intersection until they can get completely across.

column2: 42. This sign means:
column8: The road will curve to the right.
column10: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 43. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column8: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 44. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: drive slower than the flow of traffic.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.

column2: 45. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
46. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column6: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column8: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column10: pass slower vehicles on the right.

48. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column6: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 49. Before changing to the left lane while driving in the right lane on a multiple lane highway, you should:
column4: look over your left shoulder for vehicles on your left side.
column6: look in your rearview mirror for vehicles behind you.
column8: look in your side mirror for vehicles and turn on your signal light.

column2: 50. This road sign means:
column6: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles
column8: Yield to motorcyles, but not to bicycles
column10: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
